str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.
From charizomai; a gratuity, i.e. Deliverance;, a endowment, i.e. religious qualification, or miraculous faculty.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation. From apokalupto; disclosure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
